Are you a technical leader looking for an amazing experience for your first full-time job? Apply today for Lexmark's Technical Rotation Program!


The purpose of the Technical Rotation Program (TRP) is to recruit and hire top, diverse, entry level talent, and expose them to various parts of the business in order to better prepare them for future leadership roles technical and/or managerial. The Technical Rotation Program is a two-year program during which participants will rotate through three, eight month rotations. At the end of the program, participants are placed in an area of the business that matches their background and interests. It is open to upcoming graduates in Mechanical Engineering.

The Project Engineer identifies and executes capital or continuous improvement projects that increase the profitability of the facility.
The Plant (Process) Engineer assists the Management in the engineering and management of the operations of the plant facility. The program will require the Plant (Process) Engineer to work rotating shifts during the training program. The training program duration is expected to last approximately 6 or less. During this time, the Plant (Process) Engineer will be expected to learn, understand, and operate the facility. Upon completion of the training program, the Plant (Process) Engineer will transition over to working the day shift. The Plant (Process) Engineer will be responsible for the coordination of the Shift Leads and the shift operators to maintain consistent operations in accordance with established SOP’s. In addition, the position will assist the Production Manager in identifying and executing capital or continuous improvement projects that increase the profitability of the facility.

Job Title: Sr. Mechanical Engineer- CFD and FEA
Job Description:
About the Job
Looking for a Ph.D. in Mechanical Engineering
Duties include but not limited to design, failure analysis, and troubleshooting of static and rotating equipment. Periscope Homes is founded on the simple idea that adding beautiful living space should be easy. Linear Solutions Inc is an innovative provider of automation solutions for manufacturing. We design, build and install customized automation solutions for manufacturers. Our track record of continued success and growth requires us to expand our professional staff. We seek an experienced, quality-driven Mechanical Engineer to join our team.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Interpret customer automation requests and create conceptual and detail designs.
Ability to convert conceptual designs to complete engineered solutions.
Ability to create machine structure and use analysis tools to verify design.
Ability to select mechanical drive components such as motors, belts, shafts, etc
Generate mechanical prints for machine and component fabrication.

The main responsibilities for the position include (but are not restricted to):
 Business hunting activities: support efforts and work with multifunctional team (Applications, Manufacturing and Sales) on creating competitive product proposals to win important business that is in Mando’s business plan.
 Customer Requirement Analysis: collaborate with multifunctional team and support efforts to complete requirement analysis and respond to customer, complying with the requirements that can be met and negotiating exceptions for the ones that cannot be met. Be responsible for covering all the component aspects. Assist on systems aspects.
 Design creation and customer Technical Review: collaborate with application engineer and help in preparing material for technical review with customer. Create 3D design, within Mando’s guidelines and customer requirements, and package it into customer required environment. Iterate CAD design and FEA to achieve optimum performance versus mass. Create lay-outs, BOM and mass estimates. Upon program award complete tolerance stack-ups, 2D drawings and 3D refinements. Update design as customer releases changes on their packaging environment and/or requirements. Design must be created/protected for “set-based/concurrent engineering” approach for all items/features that are a new challenges.
 Program timing: support applications engineer in creating program timing, for the engineering deliverables, and support PM with the overall timing chart for the program.
 Program open issues and PDT meetings: collaborate with applications engineer on keeping open issues list up to date and collaborate with PM and team on efforts to close open issues. Provide the technical solutions to meet product performance. Support PDT meetings, only when requested by applications and/or PM.
 Gate reviews: collaborate with PM and contribute with efforts to collect information needed for each gate review and approval, with help and support from the design engineer. Raise flag, before-hand, for each potential issue or road block.
 Program Development Process: support and contribute to the efforts to complete all phases of the Product Development Process (APQP, DFMEA, PFMEA, KPC definition, etc).
 Prototype builds: release design on time for the build and collaborate with the application engineer and test coordinator to plan the build.
 DV and PV execution: provide technical solutions to all performance attributes that are not meeting internal and/or customer requirement. Support applications engineer, test coordinator and technicians with information needed for the DV and PV. Review and discuss results with applications engineer and the team (applications engineer is responsible for the DV/PV planning and reporting).
 Manufacturing and launch support: support the multifunctional team assisting plant efforts during manufacturing reviews, trials and documentation (control plans, operation sheets, flow charts, capability studies, ISIR and PPAP documentation).
 Lessons learned: just after program launch, lead efforts to capture lessons learned.
Education Requirements:
Minimum of bachelor degree in mechanical engineering or related field.
Experience and Skills Required:
Minimum of 5 years of automotive experience working in product design (CAD, FEA, Stack-ups, BOM, etc) and development environment with OEM interaction with preferred focus on conventional braking (calipers, drumbrakes, master cyl/boosters). Must possess strong analytical and problem solving skills and be able to connect academic knowledge with practical problems. Computer literate (MS Office).

Description:

The SetPoint Medical Product Development team is seeking a motivated, hardworking, and intellectually curious engineer to assist with ensuring optimal design, robust functionality, and reliable manufacturing of its medical device system.
There will be a significant amount of on-the-job technical training under the guidance and mentorship of senior members of the team. The individual in this role is expected to take an initiative in learning about all aspects of the system. As specific tasks arise, the individual will need to gather relevant data, undertake independent research, formulate hypotheses, conduct lab experiments as needed, and present findings and recommendations to the team. The individual will need to strike a balance between working on their own and leveraging the assistance of others to reach well-grounded conclusions that help guide design decisions.

Summary/Objective:
A Senior Mechanical Engineer will play a major role in the overall design of automation solutions for manufacturing and industrial applications while collaborating with peers to identify and implement solutions. The engineer should have 7+ years of experience with designing systems that involve use of robotics, conveyors, servos, AC motors, pneumatics, extrusion and weldment frames. Must have a working knowledge of safety devices, safety standards and a solid understanding of SOLIDWORKS 3D modeling. The engineer will be responsible for designing, developing and testing of all aspects of components, equipment and machinery while providing mentorship and guidance for junior engineers. The engineer responsibilities also include participating in customers meetings, providing input to engineering and business proposals, manufacturing costs and schedule estimates, reviewing junior engineer work product and developing and conducting Conceptual and Design Reviews. The Engineer will typically have 7+ years of related experience.

Job Description
DATE: 10/29/2021
POSITION TITLE: Mechanical Engineer
DEPARTMENT: Engineering Depart
REPORTS TO: Engineer Manager
POSITION SUMMARY:
SmartPlug Systems, a leading manufacturer of power delivery systems in the Marine, RV and General Industrial markets, is searching for a Mechanical / Electrical Engineer who understands the principles of electricity and electrical power delivery systems, with proven experience in a lean manufacturing environment.

The Mechanical Engineer reports to the Corporate Technical Manager and is responsible for developing well-engineered mechanical designs for mechanisms used in automated assembly, Test & special process systems. The Mechanical Engineer uses SolidWorks to produce layouts, assembly level and detail drawings, bills of materials and specifications. In this leadership role, the standard for teamwork, communication, design consistency, accuracy, efficiency, and quality documentation will be set for the project team. The Mechanical Engineer will embody our company culture with integrity and professional competence. Projects generally vary from one to the next, therefore our engineers must thrive on variety and enjoy taking on new challenges. The ideal candidate must be a flexible, results-oriented problem-solver.
Essential Function/Duties and Responsibilities
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential functions/duties satisfactorily. Other duties/functions may be added or assigned. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

The main responsibilities for the position include (but are not restricted to):
 Business hunting activities: support efforts and work with multifunctional team (Applications, Manufacturing and Sales) on creating competitive product proposals to win important business that is in Mando’s business plan.
 Customer Requirement Analysis: collaborate with multifunctional team and support efforts to complete requirement analysis and respond to customer, complying with the requirements that can be met and negotiating exceptions for the ones that cannot be met. Be responsible for covering all the component aspects. Assist on systems aspects.
 Design creation and customer Technical Review: collaborate with application engineer and help in preparing material for technical review with customer. Create 3D design, within Mando’s guidelines and customer requirements, and package it into customer required environment. Iterate CAD design and FEA to achieve optimum performance versus mass. Create lay-outs, BOM and mass estimates. Upon program award complete tolerance stack-ups, 2D drawings and 3D refinements. Update design as customer releases changes on their packaging environment and/or requirements. Design must be created/protected for “set-based/concurrent engineering” approach for all items/features that are a new challenges.
 Program timing: support applications engineer in creating program timing, for the engineering deliverables, and support PM with the overall timing chart for the program.
 Program open issues and PDT meetings: collaborate with applications engineer on keeping open issues list up to date and collaborate with PM and team on efforts to close open issues. Provide the technical solutions to meet product performance. Support PDT meetings, only when requested by applications and/or PM.
 Gate reviews: collaborate with PM and contribute with efforts to collect information needed for each gate review and approval, with help and support from the design engineer. Raise flag, before-hand, for each potential issue or road block.
 Program Development Process: support and contribute to the efforts to complete all phases of the Product Development Process (APQP, DFMEA, PFMEA, KPC definition, etc).
 Prototype builds: release design on time for the build and collaborate with the application engineer and test coordinator to plan the build.
 DV and PV execution: provide technical solutions to all performance attributes that are not meeting internal and/or customer requirement. Support applications engineer, test coordinator and technicians with information needed for the DV and PV. Review and discuss results with applications engineer and the team (applications engineer is responsible for the DV/PV planning and reporting).
 Manufacturing and launch support: support the multifunctional team assisting plant efforts during manufacturing reviews, trials and documentation (control plans, operation sheets, flow charts, capability studies, ISIR and PPAP documentation).
 Lessons learned: just after program launch, lead efforts to capture lessons learned.
Education Requirements:
Minimum of bachelor degree in mechanical engineering or related field.
Experience and Skills Required:
Minimum of 5 years of automotive experience working in product design (CAD, FEA, Stack-ups, BOM, etc) and development environment with OEM interaction with preferred focus on conventional braking (calipers, drumbrakes, master cyl/boosters). Must possess strong analytical and problem solving skills and be able to connect academic knowledge with practical problems. Computer literate (MS Office).

About Phoenix Tailings
Each year the mining industry discards over 200 billion tons of waste (tailings) and produces more than 7% of the world’s carbon emissions. Phoenix Tailings is on a mission to be the world’s first clean mining and metals production company, eliminating this harmful waste from the environment while sustainably creating valuable materials.
Starting with the humble beginnings of a few friends in a backyard thinking of how they can fix this broken system of metals production, Phoenix Tailings has become one of the top sustainability startups in the world. A Techstars Boston 2020 company with funding from the US Department of Energy, National Science Foundation, Phoenix Tailings has demonstrated the early success of its clean mining mission.
We have a long way to go, but it’s the belief that together, the right people can overcome any obstacle and change the world that is the center of Phoenix Tailings. We pride ourselves on our relentless pursuit of a better future.

Job Title: Concept Design - Mechanical Engineer, Facebook Reality Labs
Job Description:
As a Mechanical Engineer within the multidisciplinary Concept Design Team, you will employ your expertise in problem solving and prototyping to accelerate product development across Facebook’s hardware organization. You will collaborate with teams within Hardware Engineering, Research and Development, and Industrial Design. These projects cover a wide variety of technical challenges unique to Facebook’s hardware portfolio, including Oculus, Portal, and beyond. This role requires expertise in both designing and building functional prototypes, including proficiency in integrated design, CAD, rapid prototyping and fabrication processes as well as a thorough understanding of when and how to implement the appropriate processes to provide robust applied solutions. You will work at every stage of the hardware lifecycle with a particular focus on concept ideation and early-to-mid stage development. You must be able to work with minimal guidance, demonstrate a high attention to detail, be partnership-oriented and possess strong problem-solving skills. You must be a self-starter, well-organized and have excellent communication skills. Our team is constantly growing and you will be relied upon to help define team direction and be motivated to improve the effectiveness of our tools and processes from each project to the next.

Job Description
DATE: 10/29/2021
POSITION TITLE: Mechanical Engineer
DEPARTMENT: Engineering Depart
REPORTS TO: Engineer Manager
POSITION SUMMARY:
SmartPlug Systems, a leading manufacturer of power delivery systems in the Marine, RV and General Industrial markets, is searching for a Mechanical / Electrical Engineer who understands the principles of electricity and electrical power delivery systems, with proven experience in a lean manufacturing environment.

The main responsibilities for the position include (but are not restricted to):
 Business hunting activities: support efforts and work with multifunctional team (Applications, Manufacturing and Sales) on creating competitive product proposals to win important business that is in Mando’s business plan.
 Customer Requirement Analysis: collaborate with multifunctional team and support efforts to complete requirement analysis and respond to customer, complying with the requirements that can be met and negotiating exceptions for the ones that cannot be met. Be responsible for covering all the component aspects. Assist on systems aspects.
 Design creation and customer Technical Review: collaborate with application engineer and help in preparing material for technical review with customer. Create 3D design, within Mando’s guidelines and customer requirements, and package it into customer required environment. Iterate CAD design and FEA to achieve optimum performance versus mass. Create lay-outs, BOM and mass estimates. Upon program award complete tolerance stack-ups, 2D drawings and 3D refinements. Update design as customer releases changes on their packaging environment and/or requirements. Design must be created/protected for “set-based/concurrent engineering” approach for all items/features that are a new challenges.
 Program timing: support applications engineer in creating program timing, for the engineering deliverables, and support PM with the overall timing chart for the program.
 Program open issues and PDT meetings: collaborate with applications engineer on keeping open issues list up to date and collaborate with PM and team on efforts to close open issues. Provide the technical solutions to meet product performance. Support PDT meetings, only when requested by applications and/or PM.
 Gate reviews: collaborate with PM and contribute with efforts to collect information needed for each gate review and approval, with help and support from the design engineer. Raise flag, before-hand, for each potential issue or road block.
 Program Development Process: support and contribute to the efforts to complete all phases of the Product Development Process (APQP, DFMEA, PFMEA, KPC definition, etc).
 Prototype builds: release design on time for the build and collaborate with the application engineer and test coordinator to plan the build.
 DV and PV execution: provide technical solutions to all performance attributes that are not meeting internal and/or customer requirement. Support applications engineer, test coordinator and technicians with information needed for the DV and PV. Review and discuss results with applications engineer and the team (applications engineer is responsible for the DV/PV planning and reporting).
 Manufacturing and launch support: support the multifunctional team assisting plant efforts during manufacturing reviews, trials and documentation (control plans, operation sheets, flow charts, capability studies, ISIR and PPAP documentation).
 Lessons learned: just after program launch, lead efforts to capture lessons learned.
Education Requirements:
Minimum of bachelor degree in mechanical engineering or related field.
Experience and Skills Required:
Minimum of 5 years of automotive experience working in product design (CAD, FEA, Stack-ups, BOM, etc) and development environment with OEM interaction with preferred focus on conventional braking (calipers, drumbrakes, master cyl/boosters). About Periscope Homes
Periscope Homes is founded on the simple idea that adding beautiful living space should be easy. Who We’re Looking For

Job Description
DATE: 10/29/2021
POSITION TITLE: Mechanical Engineer
DEPARTMENT: Engineering Depart
REPORTS TO: Engineer Manager
POSITION SUMMARY:
SmartPlug Systems, a leading manufacturer of power delivery systems in the Marine, RV and General Industrial markets, is searching for a Mechanical / Electrical Engineer who understands the principles of electricity and electrical power delivery systems, with proven experience in a lean manufacturing environment.

The main responsibilities for the position include (but are not restricted to):
 Business hunting activities: support efforts and work with multifunctional team (Applications, Manufacturing and Sales) on creating competitive product proposals to win important business that is in Mando’s business plan.
 Customer Requirement Analysis: collaborate with multifunctional team and support efforts to complete requirement analysis and respond to customer, complying with the requirements that can be met and negotiating exceptions for the ones that cannot be met. Be responsible for covering all the component aspects. Assist on systems aspects.
 Design creation and customer Technical Review: collaborate with application engineer and help in preparing material for technical review with customer. Create 3D design, within Mando’s guidelines and customer requirements, and package it into customer required environment. Iterate CAD design and FEA to achieve optimum performance versus mass. Create lay-outs, BOM and mass estimates. Upon program award complete tolerance stack-ups, 2D drawings and 3D refinements. Update design as customer releases changes on their packaging environment and/or requirements. Design must be created/protected for “set-based/concurrent engineering” approach for all items/features that are a new challenges.
 Program timing: support applications engineer in creating program timing, for the engineering deliverables, and support PM with the overall timing chart for the program.
 Program open issues and PDT meetings: collaborate with applications engineer on keeping open issues list up to date and collaborate with PM and team on efforts to close open issues. Provide the technical solutions to meet product performance. Support PDT meetings, only when requested by applications and/or PM.
 Gate reviews: collaborate with PM and contribute with efforts to collect information needed for each gate review and approval, with help and support from the design engineer. Raise flag, before-hand, for each potential issue or road block.
 Program Development Process: support and contribute to the efforts to complete all phases of the Product Development Process (APQP, DFMEA, PFMEA, KPC definition, etc).
 Prototype builds: release design on time for the build and collaborate with the application engineer and test coordinator to plan the build.
 DV and PV execution: provide technical solutions to all performance attributes that are not meeting internal and/or customer requirement. Support applications engineer, test coordinator and technicians with information needed for the DV and PV. Review and discuss results with applications engineer and the team (applications engineer is responsible for the DV/PV planning and reporting).
 Manufacturing and launch support: support the multifunctional team assisting plant efforts during manufacturing reviews, trials and documentation (control plans, operation sheets, flow charts, capability studies, ISIR and PPAP documentation).
 Lessons learned: just after program launch, lead efforts to capture lessons learned.
Education Requirements:
Minimum of bachelor degree in mechanical engineering or related field.
Experience and Skills Required:
Minimum of 5 years of automotive experience working in product design (CAD, FEA, Stack-ups, BOM, etc) and development environment with OEM interaction with preferred focus on conventional braking (calipers, drumbrakes, master cyl/boosters). Must possess strong analytical and problem solving skills and be able to connect academic knowledge with practical problems. Computer literate (MS Office).

Design of welded sheet metal and plate metal based equipment.
Specifying and applying motors/gearboxes for rotating equipment.

POSITION OVERVIEW
Simpalm is looking to hire a mechanical engineer for a direct client in Schaumburg, IL who applies mechanical systems design knowledge, skill, and ability to create construction drawings for the project owner and provides continuous professional support throughout the entire construction process. We're looking for someone who can serve as the primary liaison responsible for coordination and communication activities between the design team and the client/customer and provides project management oversight and professional support throughout the entire construction process. This is a full-time position with benefits.
MODE OF INTERVIEW
The first round is a video screening questions via a platform called Ducknowl. The second round is an interview with the hiring manager

The main responsibilities for the position include (but are not restricted to):
 Business hunting activities: support efforts and work with multifunctional team (Applications, Manufacturing and Sales) on creating competitive product proposals to win important business that is in Mando’s business plan.
 Customer Requirement Analysis: collaborate with multifunctional team and support efforts to complete requirement analysis and respond to customer, complying with the requirements that can be met and negotiating exceptions for the ones that cannot be met. Be responsible for covering all the component aspects. Assist on systems aspects.
 Design creation and customer Technical Review: collaborate with application engineer and help in preparing material for technical review with customer. Create 3D design, within Mando’s guidelines and customer requirements, and package it into customer required environment. Iterate CAD design and FEA to achieve optimum performance versus mass. Create lay-outs, BOM and mass estimates. Upon program award complete tolerance stack-ups, 2D drawings and 3D refinements. Update design as customer releases changes on their packaging environment and/or requirements. Design must be created/protected for “set-based/concurrent engineering” approach for all items/features that are a new challenges.
 Program timing: support applications engineer in creating program timing, for the engineering deliverables, and support PM with the overall timing chart for the program.
 Program open issues and PDT meetings: collaborate with applications engineer on keeping open issues list up to date and collaborate with PM and team on efforts to close open issues. Provide the technical solutions to meet product performance. Support PDT meetings, only when requested by applications and/or PM.
 Gate reviews: collaborate with PM and contribute with efforts to collect information needed for each gate review and approval, with help and support from the design engineer. Raise flag, before-hand, for each potential issue or road block.
 Program Development Process: support and contribute to the efforts to complete all phases of the Product Development Process (APQP, DFMEA, PFMEA, KPC definition, etc).
 Prototype builds: release design on time for the build and collaborate with the application engineer and test coordinator to plan the build.
 DV and PV execution: provide technical solutions to all performance attributes that are not meeting internal and/or customer requirement. Support applications engineer, test coordinator and technicians with information needed for the DV and PV. Review and discuss results with applications engineer and the team (applications engineer is responsible for the DV/PV planning and reporting).
 Manufacturing and launch support: support the multifunctional team assisting plant efforts during manufacturing reviews, trials and documentation (control plans, operation sheets, flow charts, capability studies, ISIR and PPAP documentation).
 Lessons learned: just after program launch, lead efforts to capture lessons learned.
Education Requirements:
Minimum of bachelor degree in mechanical engineering or related field.
Experience and Skills Required:
Minimum of 5 years of automotive experience working in product design (CAD, FEA, Stack-ups, BOM, etc) and development environment with OEM interaction with preferred focus on conventional braking (calipers, drumbrakes, master cyl/boosters). Must possess strong analytical and problem solving skills and be able to connect academic knowledge with practical problems. Computer literate (MS Office).

Orbit Motion Systems is looking for a mechanical design engineer with experience in machine and subassembly design. As a specialty machine builder, we focus on automating manufacturing tasks in the fields of packaging and food and beverage industries. Using robotic technologies and motion programming competencies, we are able to build automatic equipment to support our customers.
With a focus on machine design and end of arm robotic tooling the day to day tasks would be varied as we go from project to project. Working in conjunction with our fabrication, electrical, and software staff this role will be a compliment to the existing team.
A proper candidate will be able to perform the design, layout, testing, and evaluation of mechanical assemblies and prove the viability before integration into the final machine. Previous mechanical design experience is a must and a portfolio of work will be required.

Headquartered in centrally-located Chehalis, Washington, Alta operates fence board sawmills in four other rural communities in the region: Morton, WA; Shelton, WA; Amanda Park, WA, and Naples, ID.

About Periscope Homes
Periscope Homes is founded on the simple idea that adding beautiful living space should be easy. Residential construction is neither keeping pace with demand nor improving productivity, so we’re reimagining the process. Applying product design and manufacturing know-how from “outsider” industries, our mission is giving people the superpower to create inspired living space with no hassle. Our market entry is the growing California ADU (accessory dwelling unit) market, where small and beautiful is big and valuable.
Who We’re Looking For
We seek a sharp, technical, and detail-oriented design engineer to help develop the next generation of high-end, practical living spaces at our workshop in San Francisco. This person will work directly with architects, structural engineers, general contractors, and fabricators, synthesizing their various points of view into a coherent design solution that is fully captured in 3D CAD (Onshape). A proven track record of creating beautiful, high-quality mechanical assemblies is a must. Careful parametric model planning upfront is also needed to enable the efficient creation of design permutations. Finally, a passion for detailed documentation to capture and communicate design intent is highly desirable.

Sr. Mechanical Design Engineer
6K, Inc. is a high-tech start-up based in North Andover, MA. We are focused on the production of materials for applications involving additive manufacturing, LED lighting and displays, lithium ion batteries and semiconductor polishing.
6K’s UniMelt™ plasma technology enables customers to tailor ceramic, metal or composite materials to their specifications to meet the requirements of advanced end-products.
We are looking for a Senior Mechanical Engineer who is a jack-of-all-trades type, who can contribute effectively within a high-performing, team-oriented start-up environment.
Description:

Summary/Objective:
A Senior Mechanical Engineer will play a major role in the overall design of automation solutions for manufacturing and industrial applications while collaborating with peers to identify and implement solutions. The engineer should have 7+ years of experience with designing systems that involve use of robotics, conveyors, servos, AC motors, pneumatics, extrusion and weldment frames. Must have a working knowledge of safety devices, safety standards and a solid understanding of SOLIDWORKS 3D modeling. The engineer will be responsible for designing, developing and testing of all aspects of components, equipment and machinery while providing mentorship and guidance for junior engineers. The engineer responsibilities also include participating in customers meetings, providing input to engineering and business proposals, manufacturing costs and schedule estimates, reviewing junior engineer work product and developing and conducting Conceptual and Design Reviews. The Engineer will typically have 7+ years of related experience.

NanoLumens is looking for a Mechanical Engineer who has a minimum of 3-5 years of experience in consumer or industrial product development. Candidate should possess practical knowledge of the product development cycle, 3D CAD, and mechanical engineering principles.

Intermediate to Advanced skills with 3D CAD (SolidWorks preferred) including part and assembly creation
Proficiency in engineering drafting including tolerances and Bill of Materials
Strong communication and analytical skills for interfacing with manufacturing, sales team, customers, and vendors/suppliers

Cybel is a small electro-optics company, located in Bethlehem, Pennsylvania, that designs and manufactures lasers for a wide range of applications. A successful laser design requires the careful integration of mechanical, electronic, and optical subsystems. We are looking for a student intern to help in the mechanical design of laser packages and optical setups for testing lasers. A working knowledge of SOLIDWORKS and some knowledge of machining and casting are required. The preferred candidate will also have some experience with electronic design, hardware, firmware, and software. The superior candidate will have the opportunity to work with state-of-the-art equipment to build and test optical fiber-based lasers. This is a unique opportunity to experience the fast-paced entrepreneurial atmosphere of a small business and take part in building a new product.'

About X-energy
X-energy is an entrepreneurial Gen IV nuclear power plant and fuel design company that recently signed an award winning $2,500,000,000.00/ 7 year agreement with the US Department of Energy to complete the design, licensing and construction of its compellingly safe and revolutionary design. We are aggressively staffing up with the world's most ambitious and devoted talent who share our vision of providing carbon-free, safe energy to prevent destructive global warming. This is a once in a lifetime opportunity to work for a company intent upon dominating the free market by compelling its selection as the premier nuclear energy power plant of choice around the world for the 21st Century!
Position Description
The Mechanical Design Engineer will assist in the design and development of the Fuel Handling System (FHS) mechanical components and equipment. The Mechanical Design Engineer will interact with vendors and manufactures that deal with helium and blowers and helium filters.

Turbocharged High Performance Engine Developer and Manufacturer, Banks Power, is seeking a Mechanical Design Engineer with automotive experience. Responsibilities will include researching, planning and designing mechanical and electromechanical products and systems related to automotive applications of diesel and gasoline high-performance engines along with directing and coordinating activities involved in fabrication, operation, application, installation and repair of mechanical or electromechanical products and systems.
Successful candidate will:
Use SolidWorks extensively to design stylish aftermarket automotive components and systems to achieve maximum performance. (e.g. turbochargers, intercoolers, air intakes, superchargers, wastegates, intake manifolds, exhaust manifolds, etc).
Manage multiple projects from conception through production by researching, planning, and designing mechanical and electromechanical automotive performance products and systems.

BACKGROUND:
ARCCA’s Mechanical Engineer works with clients in the insurance and legal industries to investigate and analyze a variety of mechanical system failures. Projects involve industrial machinery, consumer products, HVAC equipment, workplace safety, construction equipment, as well as general safety issues.
ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES:
Conduct investigations to gather and analyze equipment failures.
Prepare and deliver technical/educational presentations to existing and potential client groups and technical conferences.
Enhance professional/technical knowledge and credibility through continuing education programs, review of technical publications and the preparation of technical papers.
Prepare technical reports.
Provide expert testimony as required.

Company Background:
Alta Forest Products is the world's largest producer of wood fence boards, specializing in Western Red Cedar and other premium species found in the Pacific and Inland Northwest forests. In addition to producing fence boards and pallet stock lumber, Alta's zero-wood-waste sawmills produce by-products such as wood chips, sawdust, mulch and bio-fuel.
Headquartered in centrally-located Chehalis, Washington, Alta operates fence board sawmills in four other rural communities in the region: Morton, WA; Shelton, WA; Amanda Park, WA, and Naples, ID.
The Role:
As a Mechanical Project Engineer your role would be the primary design engineer on capital improvement projects. Including and preparing contracted engineering activities. You will work closely with mill leadership and maintenance teams as the acting engineering technical lead. Creating and conducting technical presentations based on short- and long-term company plans. Your initial goals, in coordination with the Project Management team will be to evaluate and document control status, develop and implement a Solid Works Vault and Mill site location mapping, leaning heavily on drawing/mapping experience.

You will be part of a diverse team in a roll your sleeves up and think outside the box company where problem solving and creativity are highly valued. Mechanical Design Engineer
About Periscope Homes
Periscope Homes is founded on the simple idea that adding beautiful living space should be easy. Residential construction is neither keeping pace with demand nor improving productivity, so we’re reimagining the process. Applying product design and manufacturing know-how from “outsider” industries, our mission is giving people the superpower to create inspired living space with no hassle. Our market entry is the growing California ADU (accessory dwelling unit) market, where small and beautiful is big and valuable.
Who We’re Looking For
We seek a sharp, technical, and detail-oriented design engineer to help develop the next generation of high-end, practical living spaces at our workshop in San Francisco. This person will work directly with architects, structural engineers, general contractors, and fabricators, synthesizing their various points of view into a coherent design solution that is fully captured in 3D CAD (Onshape). A proven track record of creating beautiful, high-quality mechanical assemblies is a must. Careful parametric model planning upfront is also needed to enable the efficient creation of design permutations. Finally, a passion for detailed documentation to capture and communicate design intent is highly desirable.

Are you a hardware minded Mechanical Design Engineer who seeks to impact the next generation of technology? Are you a team player that takes pride in solving real-world, practical problems? Join our team to be part of the future of computing and data centers!
JETCOOL Technologies is seeking a dependable Mechanical Design Engineer to join our team and produce high quality mechanical designs for never-before-seen thermal technology. The position will support multiple ongoing simultaneous projects containing designs with precision features and tightly toleranced assemblies. The position will work closely with the team’s mechanical engineers to both form designs starting at the concept stage as well as progress preliminary designs into a fully detailed, manufacturable state. A rigorous, hardworking, and self-starting individual will thrive in this fast-paced and innovative technology company.
JETCOOL Technologies is a fast-moving startup, and MIT-spinoff, producing game-changing cooling solutions for aerospace, electric vehicles, and data centers. Join us to be part of some of today’s fastest growing industries, while having a positive impact on society through technology.

E-N-G is a leading U.S. manufacturer of specialized vehicles, headquartered in Fayetteville, NC. We are proud to be an innovative producer of a diverse line of mobile technology products since 1977. E-N-G designs, develops, and builds specialized vehicles, such as Mobile Laboratories, Wireless Support Vehicles, RF Test Platforms, Broadcast Vehicles, with highly technical applications in the fields of public health and medical, advanced technology, incident command and control, and utilities services.
E-N-G collaborates closely with each client and end-user to fully understand their intended applications and specialized needs. Our ability to take sophisticated, complex ideas and translate them into easy-to-operate, high-quality mobile systems has led to our success where we have delivered more than 1,500 specialty vehicles to customers around the world.
We are currently seeking a full-time hardworking, self-motivated Mechanical / Technical Designer to help in the continued advancement of E-N-G Mobile System’s capabilities and product line. This job will be located in Fayetteville, NC. The individual must be reliable; goal oriented, and motivated to achieve improvement on a continuous basis.

Mechanical Design Engineer
We are looking for a technically savvy Mechanical Design Engineer to join our Actuation's team! Work can be located in Charlotte or Shelby NC!
Under minimal supervision, designs complex mechanical systems, equipment and packaging solutions. Conducts feasibility studies and testing on new and modified designs. Directs support personnel in the preparation of detailed design, design testing and prototype fabrication. Provides design information to drafting for finalizing documentation. Expected to use CAD and CAE systems to create design options. Other detailed analysis documentation is expected in accordance with design requirments.
Location: Charlotte, NC or Shelby, NC

Orbit Motion Systems is looking for a mechanical design engineer with experience in machine and subassembly design. As a specialty machine builder, we focus on automating manufacturing tasks in the fields of packaging and food and beverage industries. Using robotic technologies and motion programming competencies, we are able to build automatic equipment to support our customers.
With a focus on machine design and end of arm robotic tooling the day to day tasks would be varied as we go from project to project. Working in conjunction with our fabrication, electrical, and software staff this role will be a compliment to the existing team.
A proper candidate will be able to perform the design, layout, testing, and evaluation of mechanical assemblies and prove the viability before integration into the final machine. Previous mechanical design experience is a must and a portfolio of work will be required.

Introduction
ASML US brings together the most creative minds in science and technology to develop lithography machines that are key to producing faster, cheaper, more energy-efficient microchips. We design, develop, integrate, market and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers - the world’s leading chipmakers - to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics. Our headquarters are in Veldhoven, the Netherlands, and we have 18 office locations around the United States including main offices in Chandler Arizona, San Jose and San Diego California, Wilton Connecticut, and Hillsboro Oregon.
This position requires access to controlled technology, as defined in the Export Administration Regulations (15 C.F.R. § 730, et seq.). Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to access such controlled technology prior to beginning work. Business demands may require ASML to proceed with applicants who are immediately eligible to access controlled technology.

About Periscope Homes
Periscope Homes is founded on the simple idea that adding beautiful living space should be easy. Residential construction is neither keeping pace with demand nor improving productivity, so we’re reimagining the process. Applying product design and manufacturing know-how from “outsider” industries, our mission is giving people the superpower to create inspired living space with no hassle. Our market entry is the growing California ADU (accessory dwelling unit) market, where small and beautiful is big and valuable.
Who We’re Looking For
We seek a sharp, technical, and detail-oriented design engineer to help develop the next generation of high-end, practical living spaces at our workshop in San Francisco. This person will work directly with architects, structural engineers, general contractors, and fabricators, synthesizing their various points of view into a coherent design solution that is fully captured in 3D CAD (Onshape). A proven track record of creating beautiful, high-quality mechanical assemblies is a must. Careful parametric model planning upfront is also needed to enable the efficient creation of design permutations. Finally, a passion for detailed documentation to capture and communicate design intent is highly desirable.

Rockford Corporation, located in Tempe Arizona is the leading designer and manufacturer of high performance mobile audio products. JOB TITLE: Mechanical Engineer
RESPONSIBILITIES:
As a Mechanical Engineer, you will exhibit expertise in a variety of mechanical concepts, practices, and procedures. Integral contributor to new product design process. Present mechanical concepts and solutions clearly to the New Product Development team. Translate 3D surface models of industrial designs into functional mechanical parts and assemblies for manufacturing. Heavy emphasis on injection molded design, sheet metal, casting, and extrusion. Integrate mechanical designs with mating electrical assemblies. Our Engineers communicate (daily) with offshore suppliers to improve value and quality of parts and assemblies. Rely on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. You may work as the lead design engineer, or in teams. We are looking for a self-motivated engineer with a wide degree of creativity.

Torque3 is a healthcare startup developing a unique neurorehabilitation solution that will revolutionize stroke recovery, impacting the lives of stroke survivors around the world. At this stage of development Torque3 is focused on developing prototypes that will be deployed into the rehabilitation market for extensive testing to refine customer fit. The fabrication shop is setup for industrial level CNC machining, composite fabrication and plastic printing with dedicated machinists operating the equipment.
Torque3 is seeking a Mechanical Design Engineer, this onsite position is located in Centerville, UT in the greater Salt Lake City area. The selected candidate will fill the role of Design Engineer, joining our design and manufacturing team. The individual in this lead role will work closely with the concept designer and shop lead to take the prototype from idea through fabrication while accommodating modifications derived through evolutionary development.

Mechanical Design Engineer
About Periscope Homes
Periscope Homes is founded on the simple idea that adding beautiful living space should be easy. Residential construction is neither keeping pace with demand nor improving productivity, so we’re reimagining the process. Applying product design and manufacturing know-how from “outsider” industries, our mission is giving people the superpower to create inspired living space with no hassle. Our market entry is the growing California ADU (accessory dwelling unit) market, where small and beautiful is big and valuable.
Who We’re Looking For
We seek a sharp, technical, and detail-oriented design engineer to help develop the next generation of high-end, practical living spaces at our workshop in San Francisco. This person will work directly with architects, structural engineers, general contractors, and fabricators, synthesizing their various points of view into a coherent design solution that is fully captured in 3D CAD (Onshape). A proven track record of creating beautiful, high-quality mechanical assemblies is a must. Careful parametric model planning upfront is also needed to enable the efficient creation of design permutations. Finally, a passion for detailed documentation to capture and communicate design intent is highly desirable.

Are you passionate about mechanical design? Do you have experience with tooling or other tight tolerance designs? Are you looking for the opportunity to grow with a world-leading company?
Fancort Industries has been the world leader in SMT lead forming tool design and manufacturing for 5 decades. We are an award-winning supplier to all the major military and aerospace companies in the US as well as a major exporter to the world's military and space exploration companies. Our tools and capabilities are a critical process for high-value radiation-hardened chips.
For the right candidate, we are offering the chance to join our tooling design group. You will work under our senior design manager with the task of supporting design, process, and documentation improvements. Our design software is Solidworks. Our shop includes CNC as well as manual machining with many opportunities for process improvements. This position offers an excellent growth path for the candidate that has superior tight tolerance mechanical design capabilities in combination with a continuous improvement ethos.

Rockford Corporation, located in Tempe Arizona is the leading designer and manufacturer of high performance mobile audio products. We are looking to add a Mechanical Engineer to join our Engineering Team. This is a highly visible position in the company and we’re looking for a good fit within the department and the organization. We offer a casual work environment and great benefits. Our employees are very passionate about their work and are encouraged to bring new ideas and creativity to their jobs.
JOB TITLE: Mechanical Engineer
RESPONSIBILITIES:
As a Mechanical Engineer, you will exhibit expertise in a variety of mechanical concepts, practices, and procedures. Integral contributor to new product design process. Present mechanical concepts and solutions clearly to the New Product Development team. Translate 3D surface models of industrial designs into functional mechanical parts and assemblies for manufacturing. Heavy emphasis on injection molded design, sheet metal, casting, and extrusion. Integrate mechanical designs with mating electrical assemblies. Our Engineers communicate (daily) with offshore suppliers to improve value and quality of parts and assemblies. Rely on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. You may work as the lead design engineer, or in teams. We are looking for a self-motivated engineer with a wide degree of creativity.

Torque3 is a healthcare startup developing a unique neurorehabilitation solution that will revolutionize stroke recovery, impacting the lives of stroke survivors around the world. We are looking for people to join our small, dedicated team who can bring passion, expertise, and bold new ideas to the company and have some fun along the way.
At this stage of development Torque3 is focused on developing prototypes that will be deployed into the rehabilitation market for extensive testing to refine customer fit. The fabrication shop is setup for industrial level CNC machining, composite fabrication and plastic printing with dedicated machinists operating the equipment.
Torque3 is seeking a Mechanical Design Engineer, this onsite position is located in Centerville, UT in the greater Salt Lake City area. The selected candidate will fill the role of Design Engineer, joining our design and manufacturing team. The individual in this lead role will work closely with the concept designer and shop lead to take the prototype from idea through fabrication while accommodating modifications derived through evolutionary development.

Periscope Homes is founded on the simple idea that adding beautiful living space should be easy. Residential construction is neither keeping pace with demand nor improving productivity, so we’re reimagining the process. Applying product design and manufacturing know-how from “outsider” industries, our mission is giving people the superpower to create inspired living space with no hassle. Our market entry is the growing California ADU (accessory dwelling unit) market, where small and beautiful is big and valuable.
Who We’re Looking For
We seek a sharp, technical, and detail-oriented design engineer to help develop the next generation of high-end, practical living spaces at our workshop in San Francisco. This person will work directly with architects, structural engineers, general contractors, and fabricators, synthesizing their various points of view into a coherent design solution that is fully captured in 3D CAD (Onshape). A proven track record of creating beautiful, high-quality mechanical assemblies is a must. Careful parametric model planning upfront is also needed to enable the efficient creation of design permutations. Finally, a passion for detailed documentation to capture and communicate design intent is highly desirable.

Rockford Corporation, located in Tempe Arizona is the leading designer and manufacturer of high performance mobile audio products. We are looking to add a Mechanical Engineer to join our Engineering Team. This is a highly visible position in the company and we’re looking for a good fit within the department and the organization. We offer a casual work environment and great benefits. Our employees are very passionate about their work and are encouraged to bring new ideas and creativity to their jobs.
JOB TITLE: Mechanical Engineer
RESPONSIBILITIES:
As a Mechanical Engineer, you will exhibit expertise in a variety of mechanical concepts, practices, and procedures. Integral contributor to new product design process. Present mechanical concepts and solutions clearly to the New Product Development team. Translate 3D surface models of industrial designs into functional mechanical parts and assemblies for manufacturing. Heavy emphasis on injection molded design, sheet metal, casting, and extrusion. Integrate mechanical designs with mating electrical assemblies. Our Engineers communicate (daily) with offshore suppliers to improve value and quality of parts and assemblies. Rely on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. You may work as the lead design engineer, or in teams. We are looking for a self-motivated engineer with a wide degree of creativity.

E-N-G is a leading U.S. manufacturer of specialized vehicles, headquartered in Fayetteville, NC. We are proud to be an innovative producer of a diverse line of mobile technology products since 1977. E-N-G designs, develops, and builds specialized vehicles, such as Mobile Laboratories, Wireless Support Vehicles, RF Test Platforms, Broadcast Vehicles, with highly technical applications in the fields of public health and medical, advanced technology, incident command and control, and utilities services.
E-N-G collaborates closely with each client and end-user to fully understand their intended applications and specialized needs. Our ability to take sophisticated, complex ideas and translate them into easy-to-operate, high-quality mobile systems has led to our success where we have delivered more than 1,500 specialty vehicles to customers around the world.
We are currently seeking a full-time hardworking, self-motivated Mechanical / Technical Designer to help in the continued advancement of E-N-G Mobile System’s capabilities and product line. This job will be located in Fayetteville, NC. The individual must be reliable; goal oriented, and motivated to achieve improvement on a continuous basis.

Mechanical Design Engineer
We are looking for a technically savvy Mechanical Design Engineer to join our Actuation's team! Work can be located in Charlotte or Shelby NC!
Under minimal supervision, designs complex mechanical systems, equipment and packaging solutions. Conducts feasibility studies and testing on new and modified designs. Expected to use CAD and CAE systems to create design options. Other detailed analysis documentation is expected in accordance with design requirments.

Are you passionate about mechanical design? Do you have experience with tooling or other tight tolerance designs? Are you looking for the opportunity to grow with a world-leading company?
Fancort Industries has been the world leader in SMT lead forming tool design and manufacturing for 5 decades. We are an award-winning supplier to all the major military and aerospace companies in the US as well as a major exporter to the world's military and space exploration companies. Our tools and capabilities are a critical process for high-value radiation-hardened chips.
For the right candidate, we are offering the chance to join our tooling design group. You will work under our senior design manager with the task of supporting design, process, and documentation improvements. Our design software is Solidworks. Our shop includes CNC as well as manual machining with many opportunities for process improvements. This position offers an excellent growth path for the candidate that has superior tight tolerance mechanical design capabilities in combination with a continuous improvement ethos.

Torque3 is a healthcare startup developing a unique neurorehabilitation solution that will revolutionize stroke recovery, impacting the lives of stroke survivors around the world. We are looking for people to join our small, dedicated team who can bring passion, expertise, and bold new ideas to the company and have some fun along the way.
At this stage of development Torque3 is focused on developing prototypes that will be deployed into the rehabilitation market for extensive testing to refine customer fit. The fabrication shop is setup for industrial level CNC machining, composite fabrication and plastic printing with dedicated machinists operating the equipment.
Torque3 is seeking a Mechanical Design Engineer, this onsite position is located in Centerville, UT in the greater Salt Lake City area. The selected candidate will fill the role of Design Engineer, joining our design and manufacturing team. The individual in this lead role will work closely with the concept designer and shop lead to take the prototype from idea through fabrication while accommodating modifications derived through evolutionary development.

Work for a company that makes a difference.
We are growing! Critical Process Filtration is hiring for a Mechanical Engineer in Nashua, NH!
Hiring all levels of experience! On the job paid orientation and training!
About Critical Process Filtration (CPF)
Critical Process Filtration is a family owned and privately held company with a global and regional reach but a family feel. For over 20 years, CPF has been designing filtration products, and our own machinery, with the goal of becoming the number one manufacturer of process filters. We supply high-quality filters for companies in diverse industries from bio-pharmaceutical to wine and beer, juices to auto airbags. CPF is an ISO 9001 certified manufacturing facility located in Nashua, New Hampshire and is where we assemble and package all of our products in a clean-room environment. We are looking for hard-working individuals to join our manufacturing team as we continue to expand our business.

Company Background:
Alta Forest Products is the world's largest producer of wood fence boards, specializing in Western Red Cedar and other premium species found in the Pacific and Inland Northwest forests. In addition to producing fence boards and pallet stock lumber, Alta's zero-wood-waste sawmills produce by-products such as wood chips, sawdust, mulch and bio-fuel.
Headquartered in centrally-located Chehalis, Washington, Alta operates fence board sawmills in four other rural communities in the region: Morton, WA; Shelton, WA; Amanda Park, WA, and Naples, ID.
The Role:
As a Mechanical Project Engineer your role would be the primary design engineer on capital improvement projects. Including and preparing contracted engineering activities. You will work closely with mill leadership and maintenance teams as the acting engineering technical lead. Creating and conducting technical presentations based on short- and long-term company plans. Your initial goals, in coordination with the Project Management team will be to evaluate and document control status, develop and implement a Solid Works Vault and Mill site location mapping, leaning heavily on drawing/mapping experience.

BACKGROUND:
ARCCA’s Mechanical Engineer works with clients in the insurance and legal industries to investigate and analyze a variety of mechanical system failures. Projects involve industrial machinery, consumer products, HVAC equipment, workplace safety, construction equipment, as well as general safety issues.
ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES:
Conduct investigations to gather and analyze equipment failures.
Prepare and deliver technical/educational presentations to existing and potential client groups and technical conferences.
Enhance professional/technical knowledge and credibility through continuing education programs, review of technical publications and the preparation of technical papers.
Prepare technical reports.
Provide expert testimony as required.

The preferred candidate will also have some experience with electronic design, hardware, firmware, and software. The superior candidate will have the opportunity to work with state-of-the-art equipment to build and test optical fiber-based lasers. This is a unique opportunity to experience the fast-paced entrepreneurial atmosphere of a small business and take part in building a new product.'

Company Background:
Alta Forest Products is the world's largest producer of wood fence boards, specializing in Western Red Cedar and other premium species found in the Pacific and Inland Northwest forests. In addition to producing fence boards and pallet stock lumber, Alta's zero-wood-waste sawmills produce by-products such as wood chips, sawdust, mulch and bio-fuel.
Headquartered in centrally-located Chehalis, Washington, Alta operates fence board sawmills in four other rural communities in the region: Morton, WA; Shelton, WA; Amanda Park, WA, and Naples, ID.
The Role:
As a Mechanical Project Engineer your role would be the primary design engineer on capital improvement projects. Including and preparing contracted engineering activities. You will work closely with mill leadership and maintenance teams as the acting engineering technical lead. Creating and conducting technical presentations based on short- and long-term company plans. Your initial goals, in coordination with the Project Management team will be to evaluate and document control status, develop and implement a Solid Works Vault and Mill site location mapping, leaning heavily on drawing/mapping experience.

About Periscope Homes
Periscope Homes is founded on the simple idea that adding beautiful living space should be easy. Residential construction is neither keeping pace with demand nor improving productivity, so we’re reimagining the process. Applying product design and manufacturing know-how from “outsider” industries, our mission is giving people the superpower to create inspired living space with no hassle. Our market entry is the growing California ADU (accessory dwelling unit) market, where small and beautiful is big and valuable.
Who We’re Looking For
We seek a sharp, technical, and detail-oriented design engineer to help develop the next generation of high-end, practical living spaces at our workshop in San Francisco. This person will work directly with architects, structural engineers, general contractors, and fabricators, synthesizing their various points of view into a coherent design solution that is fully captured in 3D CAD (Onshape). A proven track record of creating beautiful, high-quality mechanical assemblies is a must. Careful parametric model planning upfront is also needed to enable the efficient creation of design permutations. Finally, a passion for detailed documentation to capture and communicate design intent is highly desirable.

Are you passionate about mechanical design? Do you have experience with tooling or other tight tolerance designs? Are you looking for the opportunity to grow with a world-leading company?
Fancort Industries has been the world leader in SMT lead forming tool design and manufacturing for 5 decades. We are an award-winning supplier to all the major military and aerospace companies in the US as well as a major exporter to the world's military and space exploration companies. Our tools and capabilities are a critical process for high-value radiation-hardened chips.
For the right candidate, we are offering the chance to join our tooling design group. You will work under our senior design manager with the task of supporting design, process, and documentation improvements. Our design software is Solidworks. Our shop includes CNC as well as manual machining with many opportunities for process improvements. This position offers an excellent growth path for the candidate that has superior tight tolerance mechanical design capabilities in combination with a continuous improvement ethos.

Orbit Motion Systems is looking for a mechanical design engineer with experience in machine and subassembly design. As a specialty machine builder, we focus on automating manufacturing tasks in the fields of packaging and food and beverage industries. Using robotic technologies and motion programming competencies, we are able to build automatic equipment to support our customers.
With a focus on machine design and end of arm robotic tooling the day to day tasks would be varied as we go from project to project. Working in conjunction with our fabrication, electrical, and software staff this role will be a compliment to the existing team.
A proper candidate will be able to perform the design, layout, testing, and evaluation of mechanical assemblies and prove the viability before integration into the final machine. Previous mechanical design experience is a must and a portfolio of work will be required.

Description:
Responsible for assigned activities within an engineering discipline in support of facility design, operation and maintenance. Applies broad and diversified knowledge of engineering principles and practices in the preparation of complex engineering analyses. Performs all aspects of work in engineering operations within discipline. Performs conventional structural design and analysis. Provides system integration within and across disciplines. Provides construction and project support. May provide direction to technicians, lead projects, and supervise the work of others. Able to work independently and as part of a team, utilizes engineering technology to accomplish work. Continuously improves work processes to meet customer needs.
Education/Experience at lower level:
Position typically requires a baccalaureate degree in engineering from an accredited college or university and, practical work experience to the degree necessary to perform the responsibilities outlined above. This position may be subject to DOE Order 426.2, Personnel Selection, Training, and Qualification Requirements for DOE Nuclear Facilities. This DOE Order establishes entry-level requirements to ensure employees in the positions can successfully perform the requirements of the job.

Summary: Are you the type of individual that is motivated by the challenge of a dynamic, complex, yet rewarding career? Can you utilize and exploit progressive technology and yet analytical processes to satisfy customer needs? Are you a good partner with your teammates; data driven, and individual values that align with a corporation’s mission? Does the idea of a great team atmosphere and high impact role in a growing organization whom values customer satisfaction and employee development excite you? Are you interested in being part of a team that strives to achieve high business impact, execution excellence and has a lot of fun while we are doing it?
LCR Embedded Systems, Inc. is looking for an Mechanical Design Engineer who is a passionate about mechanical design and engineering principles, who is also a solid contributor that will provide effective inter-departmental collaboration, product integration test and technical support, the design, development and release of an overall design for production of a quality embedded systems.

Job description
OVERVIEW
The Mechanical Design Engineer is an equal partner on the product development team bringing their expertise to assist in design strategies and development of our world-class consumer products. The Mechanical Design Engineer interfaces with Product Marketing, Industrial Design, Quality and liaises with production suppliers to help determine the development path that will result in a robust product.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Lead the engineering development of products through detailed understanding of performance feasibility to meet requirements

About the Job
As part of a passionate team of engineers, you will be responsible for designing a variety of molded, machined, printed, stamped, forged, and cast components and assemblies. You will play a key role in both R&D and product development for next generation sensors and navigation systems.
Engineering opportunities exist at multiple experience levels.
You should be comfortable working in a fast-paced and often uncertain environment while contributing to innovative solutions, demonstrating personal leadership, technical competence, and attention to detail.
Responsibilities

Robotunits, Inc., located in Cranbury, NJ is part of the Heron Group, a global manufacturer of Mechanical Automation Components such as Conveyors, Linear Motion Units, Machine Frames & Guarding Units.
We are currently seeking an energetic, motivated EXPERIENCED MECHANICAL DESIGN ENGINEER to join our engineering team.
Job duties and responsibilities include
Designing & integrating of mechanical systems using our product lines to fore fill customer applications
Drafting 3D models and 2D sketches in CAD software for customer quotes and shop drawings

JOB SUMMARY
The Sr. Mechanical Design Engineer, is responsible for mechanical design, detailing and compiling a bill of materials for customer manufactured automated machines and fixtures, along with managing a design team. Ensure machine to be built is functional and suits the application for which it was sold. Helping our customers achieve the best solution for the needs.
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
Capable of conception, designing and detailing a complete job.
Review, resolve and investigate opportunities that arise pertaining to active jobs.
Review procedures and make suggestions for company standard procedures.
Pursue new or revised technology, which will result in cost savings to the company.
Work with a team of other Mechanical Design Engineers, teaching, collaborating, and sharing previous learning experiences.
Provide machine manufacturing with bills of material, machine layout prints and detail prints required for mechanical machine construction.
Review with sales, manufacturing, engineering’s intent for machine construction.
Resolve problems encountered by manufacturing.
Participate in and/or lead activities that promote continuous improvement.
Participate in and/or lead activities that create a safe working environment.

Sr. Mechanical Design Engineer
6K, Inc. is a high-tech start-up based in North Andover, MA. We are focused on the production of materials for applications involving additive manufacturing, LED lighting and displays, lithium ion batteries and semiconductor polishing.
6K’s UniMelt™ plasma technology enables customers to tailor ceramic, metal or composite materials to their specifications to meet the requirements of advanced end-products.

Description:

BACKGROUND:
ARCCA’s Mechanical Engineer works with clients in the insurance and legal industries to investigate and analyze a variety of mechanical system failures. Projects involve industrial machinery, consumer products, HVAC equipment, workplace safety, construction equipment, as well as general safety issues.
ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES:
Conduct investigations to gather and analyze equipment failures.
Prepare and deliver technical/educational presentations to existing and potential client groups and technical conferences.
Enhance professional/technical knowledge and credibility through continuing education programs, review of technical publications and the preparation of technical papers.
Prepare technical reports.
Provide expert testimony as required.

Company Background:
Alta Forest Products is the world's largest producer of wood fence boards, specializing in Western Red Cedar and other premium species found in the Pacific and Inland Northwest forests. In addition to producing fence boards and pallet stock lumber, Alta's zero-wood-waste sawmills produce by-products such as wood chips, sawdust, mulch and bio-fuel.
Headquartered in centrally-located Chehalis, Washington, Alta operates fence board sawmills in four other rural communities in the region: Morton, WA; Shelton, WA; Amanda Park, WA, and Naples, ID.
The Role:
As a Mechanical Project Engineer your role would be the primary design engineer on capital improvement projects. Including and preparing contracted engineering activities. You will work closely with mill leadership and maintenance teams as the acting engineering technical lead. Creating and conducting technical presentations based on short- and long-term company plans. Your initial goals, in coordination with the Project Management team will be to evaluate and document control status, develop and implement a Solid Works Vault and Mill site location mapping, leaning heavily on drawing/mapping experience.

Description:

The SetPoint Medical Product Development team is seeking a motivated, hardworking, and intellectually curious engineer to assist with ensuring optimal design, robust functionality, and reliable manufacturing of its medical device system.
There will be a significant amount of on-the-job technical training under the guidance and mentorship of senior members of the team. The individual in this role is expected to take an initiative in learning about all aspects of the system. As specific tasks arise, the individual will need to gather relevant data, undertake independent research, formulate hypotheses, conduct lab experiments as needed, and present findings and recommendations to the team. The individual will need to strike a balance between working on their own and leveraging the assistance of others to reach well-grounded conclusions that help guide design decisions.
. Requirements:

TRAINING INTERNSHIP
Cybel is a small electro-optics company, located in Bethlehem, Pennsylvania, that designs and manufactures lasers for a wide range of applications. A successful laser design requires the careful integration of mechanical, electronic, and optical subsystems. We are looking for a student intern to help in the mechanical design of laser packages and optical setups for testing lasers. A working knowledge of SOLIDWORKS and some knowledge of machining and casting are required. The preferred candidate will also have some experience with electronic design, hardware, firmware, and software. The superior candidate will have the opportunity to work with state-of-the-art equipment to build and test optical fiber-based lasers. This is a unique opportunity to experience the fast-paced entrepreneurial atmosphere of a small business and take part in building a new product.'
'

The purpose of the Technical Rotation Program (TRP) is to recruit and hire top, diverse, entry level talent, and expose them to various parts of the business in order to better prepare them for future leadership roles technical and/or managerial. Introduction to the job
ASML US, including its affiliates and subsidiaries, bring together the most creative minds in science and technology to develop lithography machines that are key to producing faster, cheaper, more energy-efficient microchips. We design, develop, integrate, market and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers - the world’s leading chipmakers - to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics. Our headquarters are in Veldhoven, Netherlands, and we have 18 office locations around the United States including main offices in Chandler, Arizona, San Jose and San Diego, California, Wilton, Connecticut, and Hillsboro, Oregon.
