Mechanical Design Engineer
About Periscope Homes
Periscope Homes is founded on the simple idea that adding beautiful living space should be easy. Residential construction is neither keeping pace with demand nor improving productivity, so we’re reimagining the process. Applying product design and manufacturing know-how from “outsider” industries, our mission is giving people the superpower to create inspired living space with no hassle. Our market entry is the growing California ADU (accessory dwelling unit) market, where small and beautiful is big and valuable.
Who We’re Looking For
We seek a sharp, technical, and detail-oriented design engineer to help develop the next generation of high-end, practical living spaces at our workshop in San Francisco. This person will work directly with architects, structural engineers, general contractors, and fabricators, synthesizing their various points of view into a coherent design solution that is fully captured in 3D CAD (Onshape). A proven track record of creating beautiful, high-quality mechanical assemblies is a must. Careful parametric model planning upfront is also needed to enable the efficient creation of design permutations. Finally, a passion for detailed documentation to capture and communicate design intent is highly desirable.

E-N-G is a leading U.S. manufacturer of specialized vehicles, headquartered in Fayetteville, NC. We are proud to be an innovative producer of a diverse line of mobile technology products since 1977. E-N-G designs, develops, and builds specialized vehicles, such as Mobile Laboratories, Wireless Support Vehicles, RF Test Platforms, Broadcast Vehicles, with highly technical applications in the fields of public health and medical, advanced technology, incident command and control, and utilities services.
E-N-G collaborates closely with each client and end-user to fully understand their intended applications and specialized needs. Our ability to take sophisticated, complex ideas and translate them into easy-to-operate, high-quality mobile systems has led to our success where we have delivered more than 1,500 specialty vehicles to customers around the world.
We are currently seeking a full-time hardworking, self-motivated Mechanical / Technical Designer to help in the continued advancement of E-N-G Mobile System’s capabilities and product line. This job will be located in Fayetteville, NC. The individual must be reliable; goal oriented, and motivated to achieve improvement on a continuous basis.

Orbit Motion Systems is looking for a mechanical design engineer with experience in machine and subassembly design. As a specialty machine builder, we focus on automating manufacturing tasks in the fields of packaging and food and beverage industries. Using robotic technologies and motion programming competencies, we are able to build automatic equipment to support our customers.
With a focus on machine design and end of arm robotic tooling the day to day tasks would be varied as we go from project to project. Working in conjunction with our fabrication, electrical, and software staff this role will be a compliment to the existing team.
A proper candidate will be able to perform the design, layout, testing, and evaluation of mechanical assemblies and prove the viability before integration into the final machine. Previous mechanical design experience is a must and a portfolio of work will be required.

Description:
Responsible for assigned activities within an engineering discipline in support of facility design, operation and maintenance. Performs all aspects of work in engineering operations within discipline. Performs conventional structural design and analysis. Provides system integration within and across disciplines. Provides construction and project support. May provide direction to technicians, lead projects, and supervise the work of others. Able to work independently and as part of a team, utilizes engineering technology to accomplish work. Continuously improves work processes to meet customer needs.
Education/Experience at lower level:
Position typically requires a baccalaureate degree in engineering from an accredited college or university and, practical work experience to the degree necessary to perform the responsibilities outlined above. This position may be subject to DOE Order 426.2, Personnel Selection, Training, and Qualification Requirements for DOE Nuclear Facilities. This DOE Order establishes entry-level requirements to ensure employees in the positions can successfully perform the requirements of the job.

Company Background:
Alta Forest Products is the world's largest producer of wood fence boards, specializing in Western Red Cedar and other premium species found in the Pacific and Inland Northwest forests. In addition to producing fence boards and pallet stock lumber, Alta's zero-wood-waste sawmills produce by-products such as wood chips, sawdust, mulch and bio-fuel.
Headquartered in centrally-located Chehalis, Washington, Alta operates fence board sawmills in four other rural communities in the region: Morton, WA; Shelton, WA; Amanda Park, WA, and Naples, ID.
The Role:
As a Mechanical Project Engineer your role would be the primary design engineer on capital improvement projects. Including and preparing contracted engineering activities. You will work closely with mill leadership and maintenance teams as the acting engineering technical lead. Creating and conducting technical presentations based on short- and long-term company plans. Your initial goals, in coordination with the Project Management team will be to evaluate and document control status, develop and implement a Solid Works Vault and Mill site location mapping, leaning heavily on drawing/mapping experience.

Are you a technical leader looking for an amazing experience for your first full-time job? Apply today for Lexmark's Technical Rotation Program!


The purpose of the Technical Rotation Program (TRP) is to recruit and hire top, diverse, entry level talent, and expose them to various parts of the business in order to better prepare them for future leadership roles technical and/or managerial. The Technical Rotation Program is a two-year program during which participants will rotate through three, eight month rotations. At the end of the program, participants are placed in an area of the business that matches their background and interests. It is open to upcoming graduates in Mechanical Engineering.

The SetPoint Medical Product Development team is seeking a motivated, hardworking, and intellectually curious engineer to assist with ensuring optimal design, robust functionality, and reliable manufacturing of its medical device system.

TRAINING INTERNSHIP
Cybel is a small electro-optics company, located in Bethlehem, Pennsylvania, that designs and manufactures lasers for a wide range of applications. A successful laser design requires the careful integration of mechanical, electronic, and optical subsystems. We are looking for a student intern to help in the mechanical design of laser packages and optical setups for testing lasers. The preferred candidate will also have some experience with electronic design, hardware, firmware, and software. The superior candidate will have the opportunity to work with state-of-the-art equipment to build and test optical fiber-based lasers. Company Background:
Alta Forest Products is the world's largest producer of wood fence boards, specializing in Western Red Cedar and other premium species found in the Pacific and Inland Northwest forests. In addition to producing fence boards and pallet stock lumber, Alta's zero-wood-waste sawmills produce by-products such as wood chips, sawdust, mulch and bio-fuel.
Headquartered in centrally-located Chehalis, Washington, Alta operates fence board sawmills in four other rural communities in the region: Morton, WA; Shelton, WA; Amanda Park, WA, and Naples, ID.
The Role:
As a Mechanical Project Engineer your role would be the primary design engineer on capital improvement projects. Including and preparing contracted engineering activities. You will work closely with mill leadership and maintenance teams as the acting engineering technical lead. Creating and conducting technical presentations based on short- and long-term company plans. Your initial goals, in coordination with the Project Management team will be to evaluate and document control status, develop and implement a Solid Works Vault and Mill site location mapping, leaning heavily on drawing/mapping experience.

Manage multiple projects from conception through production by researching, planning, and designing mechanical and electromechanical automotive performance products and systems.

Are you a technical leader looking for an amazing experience for your first full-time job? Apply today for Lexmark's Technical Rotation Program!


The purpose of the Technical Rotation Program (TRP) is to recruit and hire top, diverse, entry level talent, and expose them to various parts of the business in order to better prepare them for future leadership roles technical and/or managerial. The Technical Rotation Program is a two-year program during which participants will rotate through three, eight month rotations. At the end of the program, participants are placed in an area of the business that matches their background and interests. It is open to upcoming graduates in Mechanical Engineering.

Mechanical Design Engineer
About Periscope Homes
Periscope Homes is founded on the simple idea that adding beautiful living space should be easy. Residential construction is neither keeping pace with demand nor improving productivity, so we’re reimagining the process. Applying product design and manufacturing know-how from “outsider” industries, our mission is giving people the superpower to create inspired living space with no hassle. Our market entry is the growing California ADU (accessory dwelling unit) market, where small and beautiful is big and valuable.
Who We’re Looking For
We seek a sharp, technical, and detail-oriented design engineer to help develop the next generation of high-end, practical living spaces at our workshop in San Francisco. This person will work directly with architects, structural engineers, general contractors, and fabricators, synthesizing their various points of view into a coherent design solution that is fully captured in 3D CAD (Onshape). A proven track record of creating beautiful, high-quality mechanical assemblies is a must. Careful parametric model planning upfront is also needed to enable the efficient creation of design permutations. Finally, a passion for detailed documentation to capture and communicate design intent is highly desirable.

E-N-G is a leading U.S. manufacturer of specialized vehicles, headquartered in Fayetteville, NC. We are proud to be an innovative producer of a diverse line of mobile technology products since 1977. E-N-G designs, develops, and builds specialized vehicles, such as Mobile Laboratories, Wireless Support Vehicles, RF Test Platforms, Broadcast Vehicles, with highly technical applications in the fields of public health and medical, advanced technology, incident command and control, and utilities services.
E-N-G collaborates closely with each client and end-user to fully understand their intended applications and specialized needs. Our ability to take sophisticated, complex ideas and translate them into easy-to-operate, high-quality mobile systems has led to our success where we have delivered more than 1,500 specialty vehicles to customers around the world.
We are currently seeking a full-time hardworking, self-motivated Mechanical / Technical Designer to help in the continued advancement of E-N-G Mobile System’s capabilities and product line. This job will be located in Fayetteville, NC. The individual must be reliable; goal oriented, and motivated to achieve improvement on a continuous basis.

Are you passionate about mechanical design? Do you have experience with tooling or other tight tolerance designs? Are you looking for the opportunity to grow with a world-leading company?
Fancort Industries has been the world leader in SMT lead forming tool design and manufacturing for 5 decades. We are an award-winning supplier to all the major military and aerospace companies in the US as well as a major exporter to the world's military and space exploration companies. Our tools and capabilities are a critical process for high-value radiation-hardened chips.
For the right candidate, we are offering the chance to join our tooling design group. You will work under our senior design manager with the task of supporting design, process, and documentation improvements. Our design software is Solidworks. Our shop includes CNC as well as manual machining with many opportunities for process improvements. This position offers an excellent growth path for the candidate that has superior tight tolerance mechanical design capabilities in combination with a continuous improvement ethos.

Torque3 is a healthcare startup developing a unique neurorehabilitation solution that will revolutionize stroke recovery, impacting the lives of stroke survivors around the world. We are looking for people to join our small, dedicated team who can bring passion, expertise, and bold new ideas to the company and have some fun along the way.
At this stage of development Torque3 is focused on developing prototypes that will be deployed into the rehabilitation market for extensive testing to refine customer fit. The fabrication shop is setup for industrial level CNC machining, composite fabrication and plastic printing with dedicated machinists operating the equipment.
Torque3 is seeking a Mechanical Design Engineer, this onsite position is located in Centerville, UT in the greater Salt Lake City area. The selected candidate will fill the role of Design Engineer, joining our design and manufacturing team. The individual in this lead role will work closely with the concept designer and shop lead to take the prototype from idea through fabrication while accommodating modifications derived through evolutionary development.

As a healthcare company committed to protecting the health and safety for our employees, contractors, customers and communities, employees in this role are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, unless an accommodation has been granted for a medical reason or sincerely held religious belief.

Agilent inspires and supports discoveries that advance the quality of life. Agilent enables customers to gain the answers and insights they seek - so they can do what they do best: improve the world around us. Information about Agilent is available at www.agilent.com.

Mechanical Design Engineer
About Periscope Homes
Periscope Homes is founded on the simple idea that adding beautiful living space should be easy. Residential construction is neither keeping pace with demand nor improving productivity, so we’re reimagining the process. Applying product design and manufacturing know-how from “outsider” industries, our mission is giving people the superpower to create inspired living space with no hassle. Our market entry is the growing California ADU (accessory dwelling unit) market, where small and beautiful is big and valuable.
Who We’re Looking For
We seek a sharp, technical, and detail-oriented design engineer to help develop the next generation of high-end, practical living spaces at our workshop in San Francisco. This person will work directly with architects, structural engineers, general contractors, and fabricators, synthesizing their various points of view into a coherent design solution that is fully captured in 3D CAD (Onshape). A proven track record of creating beautiful, high-quality mechanical assemblies is a must. Careful parametric model planning upfront is also needed to enable the efficient creation of design permutations. Finally, a passion for detailed documentation to capture and communicate design intent is highly desirable.

E-N-G is a leading U.S. manufacturer of specialized vehicles, headquartered in Fayetteville, NC. We are proud to be an innovative producer of a diverse line of mobile technology products since 1977. E-N-G designs, develops, and builds specialized vehicles, such as Mobile Laboratories, Wireless Support Vehicles, RF Test Platforms, Broadcast Vehicles, with highly technical applications in the fields of public health and medical, advanced technology, incident command and control, and utilities services.
E-N-G collaborates closely with each client and end-user to fully understand their intended applications and specialized needs. Our ability to take sophisticated, complex ideas and translate them into easy-to-operate, high-quality mobile systems has led to our success where we have delivered more than 1,500 specialty vehicles to customers around the world.
We are currently seeking a full-time hardworking, self-motivated Mechanical / Technical Designer to help in the continued advancement of E-N-G Mobile System’s capabilities and product line. This job will be located in Fayetteville, NC. The individual must be reliable; goal oriented, and motivated to achieve improvement on a continuous basis.

Rockford Corporation, located in Tempe Arizona is the leading designer and manufacturer of high performance mobile audio products. JOB TITLE: Mechanical Engineer
RESPONSIBILITIES:
As a Mechanical Engineer, you will exhibit expertise in a variety of mechanical concepts, practices, and procedures. Integral contributor to new product design process. Present mechanical concepts and solutions clearly to the New Product Development team. Translate 3D surface models of industrial designs into functional mechanical parts and assemblies for manufacturing. Heavy emphasis on injection molded design, sheet metal, casting, and extrusion. Integrate mechanical designs with mating electrical assemblies. Our Engineers communicate (daily) with offshore suppliers to improve value and quality of parts and assemblies. Rely on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. You may work as the lead design engineer, or in teams. We are looking for a self-motivated engineer with a wide degree of creativity.

Fancort Industries has been the world leader in SMT lead forming tool design and manufacturing for 5 decades. BACKGROUND:
ARCCA’s Mechanical Engineer works with clients in the insurance and legal industries to investigate and analyze a variety of mechanical system failures. Projects involve industrial machinery, consumer products, HVAC equipment, workplace safety, construction equipment, as well as general safety issues.
ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES:
Conduct investigations to gather and analyze equipment failures.
Prepare and deliver technical/educational presentations to existing and potential client groups and technical conferences.
Enhance professional/technical knowledge and credibility through continuing education programs, review of technical publications and the preparation of technical papers.
Prepare technical reports.
Provide expert testimony as required.

Company Background:
Alta Forest Products is the world's largest producer of wood fence boards, specializing in Western Red Cedar and other premium species found in the Pacific and Inland Northwest forests. In addition to producing fence boards and pallet stock lumber, Alta's zero-wood-waste sawmills produce by-products such as wood chips, sawdust, mulch and bio-fuel.
Headquartered in centrally-located Chehalis, Washington, Alta operates fence board sawmills in four other rural communities in the region: Morton, WA; Shelton, WA; Amanda Park, WA, and Naples, ID.
The Role:
As a Mechanical Project Engineer your role would be the primary design engineer on capital improvement projects. Including and preparing contracted engineering activities. You will work closely with mill leadership and maintenance teams as the acting engineering technical lead. Creating and conducting technical presentations based on short- and long-term company plans. Your initial goals, in coordination with the Project Management team will be to evaluate and document control status, develop and implement a Solid Works Vault and Mill site location mapping, leaning heavily on drawing/mapping experience.

Description:

The SetPoint Medical Product Development team is seeking a motivated, hardworking, and intellectually curious engineer to assist with ensuring optimal design, robust functionality, and reliable manufacturing of its medical device system.
There will be a significant amount of on-the-job technical training under the guidance and mentorship of senior members of the team. The individual in this role is expected to take an initiative in learning about all aspects of the system. As specific tasks arise, the individual will need to gather relevant data, undertake independent research, formulate hypotheses, conduct lab experiments as needed, and present findings and recommendations to the team. The superior candidate will have the opportunity to work with state-of-the-art equipment to build and test optical fiber-based lasers. Mechanical Design Engineer
About Periscope Homes
Periscope Homes is founded on the simple idea that adding beautiful living space should be easy. Residential construction is neither keeping pace with demand nor improving productivity, so we’re reimagining the process. Applying product design and manufacturing know-how from “outsider” industries, our mission is giving people the superpower to create inspired living space with no hassle. Our market entry is the growing California ADU (accessory dwelling unit) market, where small and beautiful is big and valuable.
Who We’re Looking For
We seek a sharp, technical, and detail-oriented design engineer to help develop the next generation of high-end, practical living spaces at our workshop in San Francisco. This person will work directly with architects, structural engineers, general contractors, and fabricators, synthesizing their various points of view into a coherent design solution that is fully captured in 3D CAD (Onshape). A proven track record of creating beautiful, high-quality mechanical assemblies is a must. Careful parametric model planning upfront is also needed to enable the efficient creation of design permutations. Finally, a passion for detailed documentation to capture and communicate design intent is highly desirable.

Mechanical Design Engineer
We are looking for a technically savvy Mechanical Design Engineer to join our Actuation's team! Work can be located in Charlotte or Shelby NC!
Under minimal supervision, designs complex mechanical systems, equipment and packaging solutions. Conducts feasibility studies and testing on new and modified designs. Directs support personnel in the preparation of detailed design, design testing and prototype fabrication. Provides design information to drafting for finalizing documentation. Expected to use CAD and CAE systems to create design options. Other detailed analysis documentation is expected in accordance with design requirments.
Location: Charlotte, NC or Shelby, NC

Company Background:
Alta Forest Products is the world's largest producer of wood fence boards, specializing in Western Red Cedar and other premium species found in the Pacific and Inland Northwest forests. In addition to producing fence boards and pallet stock lumber, Alta's zero-wood-waste sawmills produce by-products such as wood chips, sawdust, mulch and bio-fuel.
Headquartered in centrally-located Chehalis, Washington, Alta operates fence board sawmills in four other rural communities in the region: Morton, WA; Shelton, WA; Amanda Park, WA, and Naples, ID.
The Role:
As a Mechanical Project Engineer your role would be the primary design engineer on capital improvement projects. Including and preparing contracted engineering activities. You will work closely with mill leadership and maintenance teams as the acting engineering technical lead. Creating and conducting technical presentations based on short- and long-term company plans. Your initial goals, in coordination with the Project Management team will be to evaluate and document control status, develop and implement a Solid Works Vault and Mill site location mapping, leaning heavily on drawing/mapping experience.

Are you a technical leader looking for an amazing experience for your first full-time job? Apply today for Lexmark's Technical Rotation Program!


The purpose of the Technical Rotation Program (TRP) is to recruit and hire top, diverse, entry level talent, and expose them to various parts of the business in order to better prepare them for future leadership roles technical and/or managerial. The Technical Rotation Program is a two-year program during which participants will rotate through three, eight month rotations. At the end of the program, participants are placed in an area of the business that matches their background and interests. It is open to upcoming graduates in Mechanical Engineering.

Rockford Corporation, located in Tempe Arizona is the leading designer and manufacturer of high performance mobile audio products. JOB TITLE: Mechanical Engineer
RESPONSIBILITIES:
As a Mechanical Engineer, you will exhibit expertise in a variety of mechanical concepts, practices, and procedures. Integral contributor to new product design process. Present mechanical concepts and solutions clearly to the New Product Development team. Translate 3D surface models of industrial designs into functional mechanical parts and assemblies for manufacturing. Heavy emphasis on injection molded design, sheet metal, casting, and extrusion. Integrate mechanical designs with mating electrical assemblies. Our Engineers communicate (daily) with offshore suppliers to improve value and quality of parts and assemblies. Rely on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. You may work as the lead design engineer, or in teams. We are looking for a self-motivated engineer with a wide degree of creativity.

E-N-G is a leading U.S. manufacturer of specialized vehicles, headquartered in Fayetteville, NC. We are proud to be an innovative producer of a diverse line of mobile technology products since 1977. E-N-G designs, develops, and builds specialized vehicles, such as Mobile Laboratories, Wireless Support Vehicles, RF Test Platforms, Broadcast Vehicles, with highly technical applications in the fields of public health and medical, advanced technology, incident command and control, and utilities services.
E-N-G collaborates closely with each client and end-user to fully understand their intended applications and specialized needs. Our ability to take sophisticated, complex ideas and translate them into easy-to-operate, high-quality mobile systems has led to our success where we have delivered more than 1,500 specialty vehicles to customers around the world.
We are currently seeking a full-time hardworking, self-motivated Mechanical / Technical Designer to help in the continued advancement of E-N-G Mobile System’s capabilities and product line. This job will be located in Fayetteville, NC. The individual must be reliable; goal oriented, and motivated to achieve improvement on a continuous basis.

Mechanical Design Engineer
About Periscope Homes
Periscope Homes is founded on the simple idea that adding beautiful living space should be easy. Residential construction is neither keeping pace with demand nor improving productivity, so we’re reimagining the process. Applying product design and manufacturing know-how from “outsider” industries, our mission is giving people the superpower to create inspired living space with no hassle. Our market entry is the growing California ADU (accessory dwelling unit) market, where small and beautiful is big and valuable.
Who We’re Looking For
We seek a sharp, technical, and detail-oriented design engineer to help develop the next generation of high-end, practical living spaces at our workshop in San Francisco. This person will work directly with architects, structural engineers, general contractors, and fabricators, synthesizing their various points of view into a coherent design solution that is fully captured in 3D CAD (Onshape). A proven track record of creating beautiful, high-quality mechanical assemblies is a must. Careful parametric model planning upfront is also needed to enable the efficient creation of design permutations. Finally, a passion for detailed documentation to capture and communicate design intent is highly desirable.

Are you passionate about mechanical design? Do you have experience with tooling or other tight tolerance designs? Are you looking for the opportunity to grow with a world-leading company?
Fancort Industries has been the world leader in SMT lead forming tool design and manufacturing for 5 decades. We are an award-winning supplier to all the major military and aerospace companies in the US as well as a major exporter to the world's military and space exploration companies. Our tools and capabilities are a critical process for high-value radiation-hardened chips.
For the right candidate, we are offering the chance to join our tooling design group. You will work under our senior design manager with the task of supporting design, process, and documentation improvements. Our design software is Solidworks. Our shop includes CNC as well as manual machining with many opportunities for process improvements. This position offers an excellent growth path for the candidate that has superior tight tolerance mechanical design capabilities in combination with a continuous improvement ethos.

Orbit Motion Systems is looking for a mechanical design engineer with experience in machine and subassembly design. Description:

BACKGROUND:
ARCCA’s Mechanical Engineer works with clients in the insurance and legal industries to investigate and analyze a variety of mechanical system failures. Projects involve industrial machinery, consumer products, HVAC equipment, workplace safety, construction equipment, as well as general safety issues.
ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES:
Conduct investigations to gather and analyze equipment failures.
Prepare and deliver technical/educational presentations to existing and potential client groups and technical conferences.
Enhance professional/technical knowledge and credibility through continuing education programs, review of technical publications and the preparation of technical papers.
Prepare technical reports.
Provide expert testimony as required.

Company Background:
Alta Forest Products is the world's largest producer of wood fence boards, specializing in Western Red Cedar and other premium species found in the Pacific and Inland Northwest forests. In addition to producing fence boards and pallet stock lumber, Alta's zero-wood-waste sawmills produce by-products such as wood chips, sawdust, mulch and bio-fuel.
Headquartered in centrally-located Chehalis, Washington, Alta operates fence board sawmills in four other rural communities in the region: Morton, WA; Shelton, WA; Amanda Park, WA, and Naples, ID.
The Role:
As a Mechanical Project Engineer your role would be the primary design engineer on capital improvement projects. Including and preparing contracted engineering activities. You will work closely with mill leadership and maintenance teams as the acting engineering technical lead. Creating and conducting technical presentations based on short- and long-term company plans. Your initial goals, in coordination with the Project Management team will be to evaluate and document control status, develop and implement a Solid Works Vault and Mill site location mapping, leaning heavily on drawing/mapping experience.

Turbocharged High Performance Engine Developer and Manufacturer, Banks Power, is seeking a Mechanical Design Engineer with automotive experience. Responsibilities will include researching, planning and designing mechanical and electromechanical products and systems related to automotive applications of diesel and gasoline high-performance engines along with directing and coordinating activities involved in fabrication, operation, application, installation and repair of mechanical or electromechanical products and systems.
Successful candidate will:
Use SolidWorks extensively to design stylish aftermarket automotive components and systems to achieve maximum performance. (e.g. turbochargers, intercoolers, air intakes, superchargers, wastegates, intake manifolds, exhaust manifolds, etc).
Manage multiple projects from conception through production by researching, planning, and designing mechanical and electromechanical automotive performance products and systems.

Based in Eagan, MN, Ironwood Electronics is a premier manufacturer of semiconductor test components. With customers all over the world, our mission is to design and manufacture world-class products within the industry’s shortest available lead times. We are a mid-sized company with a big footprint and seeking an Entry level mechanical engineering position for our growing, leading edge technology and manufacturing company. Engineering duties will include design and development of mechanical IC sockets and adaptors for the electronics industry. Most projects are fast paced individual efforts, however the ability to work efficiently and productively within a design team is also required.
Engineering Design, SolidWorks 3D modeling required, proficiency in mechanical systems, statics and dynamics, cam design and heat transfer is highly preferred
General/Computer Skills: MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) Statistics, Technical Writing

TRAINING INTERNSHIP
Cybel is a small electro-optics company, located in Bethlehem, Pennsylvania, that designs and manufactures lasers for a wide range of applications. A successful laser design requires the careful integration of mechanical, electronic, and optical subsystems. We are looking for a student intern to help in the mechanical design of laser packages and optical setups for testing lasers. A working knowledge of SOLIDWORKS and some knowledge of machining and casting are required. The preferred candidate will also have some experience with electronic design, hardware, firmware, and software. The superior candidate will have the opportunity to work with state-of-the-art equipment to build and test optical fiber-based lasers. This is a unique opportunity to experience the fast-paced entrepreneurial atmosphere of a small business and take part in building a new product.'

Are you a technical leader looking for an amazing experience for your first full-time job? Apply today for Lexmark's Technical Rotation Program!


The purpose of the Technical Rotation Program (TRP) is to recruit and hire top, diverse, entry level talent, and expose them to various parts of the business in order to better prepare them for future leadership roles technical and/or managerial. The Technical Rotation Program is a two-year program during which participants will rotate through three, eight month rotations. At the end of the program, participants are placed in an area of the business that matches their background and interests. It is open to upcoming graduates in Mechanical Engineering.

Rockford Corporation, located in Tempe Arizona is the leading designer and manufacturer of high performance mobile audio products. We are looking to add a Mechanical Engineer to join our Engineering Team. This is a highly visible position in the company and we’re looking for a good fit within the department and the organization. We offer a casual work environment and great benefits. Our employees are very passionate about their work and are encouraged to bring new ideas and creativity to their jobs.
JOB TITLE: Mechanical Engineer
RESPONSIBILITIES:
As a Mechanical Engineer, you will exhibit expertise in a variety of mechanical concepts, practices, and procedures. Integral contributor to new product design process. Present mechanical concepts and solutions clearly to the New Product Development team. Translate 3D surface models of industrial designs into functional mechanical parts and assemblies for manufacturing. Heavy emphasis on injection molded design, sheet metal, casting, and extrusion. Integrate mechanical designs with mating electrical assemblies. Our Engineers communicate (daily) with offshore suppliers to improve value and quality of parts and assemblies. Rely on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. You may work as the lead design engineer, or in teams. We are looking for a self-motivated engineer with a wide degree of creativity.

E-N-G is a leading U.S. manufacturer of specialized vehicles, headquartered in Fayetteville, NC. We are proud to be an innovative producer of a diverse line of mobile technology products since 1977. E-N-G designs, develops, and builds specialized vehicles, such as Mobile Laboratories, Wireless Support Vehicles, RF Test Platforms, Broadcast Vehicles, with highly technical applications in the fields of public health and medical, advanced technology, incident command and control, and utilities services.
E-N-G collaborates closely with each client and end-user to fully understand their intended applications and specialized needs. Our ability to take sophisticated, complex ideas and translate them into easy-to-operate, high-quality mobile systems has led to our success where we have delivered more than 1,500 specialty vehicles to customers around the world.
We are currently seeking a full-time hardworking, self-motivated Mechanical / Technical Designer to help in the continued advancement of E-N-G Mobile System’s capabilities and product line. This job will be located in Fayetteville, NC. The individual must be reliable; goal oriented, and motivated to achieve improvement on a continuous basis.

Mechanical Design Engineer
About Periscope Homes
Periscope Homes is founded on the simple idea that adding beautiful living space should be easy. Residential construction is neither keeping pace with demand nor improving productivity, so we’re reimagining the process. Applying product design and manufacturing know-how from “outsider” industries, our mission is giving people the superpower to create inspired living space with no hassle. Our market entry is the growing California ADU (accessory dwelling unit) market, where small and beautiful is big and valuable.
Who We’re Looking For
We seek a sharp, technical, and detail-oriented design engineer to help develop the next generation of high-end, practical living spaces at our workshop in San Francisco. This person will work directly with architects, structural engineers, general contractors, and fabricators, synthesizing their various points of view into a coherent design solution that is fully captured in 3D CAD (Onshape). A proven track record of creating beautiful, high-quality mechanical assemblies is a must. Careful parametric model planning upfront is also needed to enable the efficient creation of design permutations. Finally, a passion for detailed documentation to capture and communicate design intent is highly desirable.

Are you passionate about mechanical design? Do you have experience with tooling or other tight tolerance designs? Are you looking for the opportunity to grow with a world-leading company?
Fancort Industries has been the world leader in SMT lead forming tool design and manufacturing for 5 decades. We are an award-winning supplier to all the major military and aerospace companies in the US as well as a major exporter to the world's military and space exploration companies. Our tools and capabilities are a critical process for high-value radiation-hardened chips.
For the right candidate, we are offering the chance to join our tooling design group. You will work under our senior design manager with the task of supporting design, process, and documentation improvements. Our design software is Solidworks. Our shop includes CNC as well as manual machining with many opportunities for process improvements. This position offers an excellent growth path for the candidate that has superior tight tolerance mechanical design capabilities in combination with a continuous improvement ethos.

Are you a technical leader looking for an amazing experience for your first full-time job? Apply today for Lexmark's Technical Rotation Program!


The purpose of the Technical Rotation Program (TRP) is to recruit and hire top, diverse, entry level talent, and expose them to various parts of the business in order to better prepare them for future leadership roles technical and/or managerial. The Technical Rotation Program is a two-year program during which participants will rotate through three, eight month rotations. At the end of the program, participants are placed in an area of the business that matches their background and interests. It is open to upcoming graduates in Mechanical Engineering.

About Periscope Homes
Periscope Homes is founded on the simple idea that adding beautiful living space should be easy. Who We’re Looking For
